content.prompt:
The x axis ranges from negative 2 to 4 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 3 to 3 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

  • The curve enters the window at (negative 1.5 comma negative 3.5).
  • The curve increases to reach a high point at (negative 1 comma 0).
  • The curve decreases to reach a low point at (negative 0.4 comma negative 0.8).
  • The curve increases to pass through the origin and reach a high point at (1 comma 3.2).
  • The curve decreases to cross the x axis at (2 comma 0) and reach a low point at (2.4 comma negative 0.8).
  • The curve increases to reach a high point at (3 comma 0).
  • The curve decreases to exit the window at (3.5 comma negative 3.5). 
  • The curve appears to be symmetric about the vertical line x = 1.

​The graph of the polynomial function g is shown. The function f is defined for 0≤x≤3 and is identical to the function g on that interval. How many total local minima and local maxima does the function f have?

topic.text: 1.4: Polynomial Functions and Rates of Change

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
